results.description:
This is a different kind of single parent support group. Single Parents Sharing Resources is a cooperative that will enable single parents to built networks to create a practical support system in Rockland/Bergen Counties and Western Westchester, to empower families socially, spiritually, and economically.

Single parents can be isolated and overworked. This group will enable members to team up with other local single parents to share childcare, share resources, and share rent/mortgages (homesharing). Meetups will enable parents to meet and connect with other like-minded single parents looking to create practical support systems. 

Even finding one other parent to team up with to share meals with on a weekly basis can be a boon, reducing the workload and creating social connections and support (for example: dinner at your house Tuesdays, dinner at my house Wednesdays). In the past, meeting other local parent(s) whose schedule matched yours was difficult, but modern technology enables these connections.

Examples of support systems we're creating include but are not limited to:

 -Childcare cooperatives: can be as simple as getting together with one other parent to take turns doing childcare. Can be as elaborate as large groups that keep track of child-care credits or home-school cooperatives. 

-Resource sharing--clothing swaps, costume swaps, sharing items like lawn mowers, cooking tools, canning tools, et al.

 -Home-sharing--connect with other parents looking to team up to provide daily practical support to each other and split the costs of home rentals or mortgages through home-sharing. 

-Meal sharing--taking turns with other parents to cook and host meals. Great to not have to cook dinner every night, and creates social support system as well. 

-Work parties: need to clean out the garage, move, make dinner, bake bread, build a play structure, build a chicken coop, etc, etc, etc? Host a work party, have fun, and get helping hands on the job.

Join us and explore the exciting possibilities for THRIVING when single parents team up!
results.name: Single Parents Sharing Resources, Hudson Gateway

results.description:
"Modern life seems to condemn us to live in an awe-depleted, efficiency driven world, where reductionism runs rampant and big questions about life are all but eradicated".  (The New Existentialist)


Hello and welcome to Perennial Philosophies.

This is a reading and discussion group. Ideally, we will read an assignment (essay, article, novel, treatise, poem/song, letters, et cetera), or watch some footage, and then gather to share our respective engagement with the assignment. A discussion will ensue of which I shall moderate and facilitate (~2 hours). I welcome your conscientiousness.

Membership is open to people with or without a background in philosophy. Nonetheless, an earnest fidelity to the discussion is mandatory.

In addition, an interdisciplinary/integral attitude to the material(s) and idea(s) is encouraged, yet any ideological perspective , or lifestyle/method is welcomed.

Western and Eastern material will be explored; from the Axial Age to late-modernity, from Reason to Revelation, from magic to quantum physics.

Our daily lives are full of things/experiences that keep us busy, preoccupied and dormant. Yet every now and again, we find ourselves drawing-back, reflecting, and wondering; what is it all about?

Perhaps a new consciousness might momentarily emerge; a ripple of truth appear ......

So, let's gather, discuss, pause, reflect and then leave each meet-up/conversation with a perspective wider, deeper, and richer than the one we had when entering it.   A perennial awakening?
results.name: Perennial Philosophies : a reading & conversation group

At our clubhouse, "DaBunka!", we paint, craft, design, custom terrain and our miniatures (man-barbies), talk shop about the game, plan trips to conventions, brush up on rules, and plot each others demise....


Our club also organizes the vast spectrum 40k tournament formats in the Greater New York area, monthly. Stay tuned for upcoming events in your "Discussions" section.



If you're a 40k gaming junkie like the rest of our merry, bog-eyed bunch, then make an effort to say "hello". You can find out more information on us in our forums section, here on MeetUp.



What are you waiting for? The bells of destiny toll your deathknell...We'll stock a warm coffin with your name on it.

results.description:
About NYC Digital Photography Club...

AFTER JUNE 30TH, THIS GROUP WILL ONLY OFFER SEMI-PRIVATE AND PRIVATE WORKSHOPS AND WALKS ONLY.


For insurance purposes, we are no longer accepting registrations for workshops and walks through THIS Meetup group. To register for our workshops and walks, please visit our sister group NYC Digital Photography Workshops official website at: http://www.nycdpw.com OR its Meetup website at: http://www.meetup.com/NYCDPW/.


We list workshops on this Meetup website to let you know what’s available, but you must register for our offerings as listed above.


New to photography? Know your way around a camera but your skills need some fine tuning?


With so many resources now available out there, where do you start? New York City, itself, hosts over 100 groups on photography instruction, but do they have near a century of photography experience to back that up? And more importantly, the drive to share that knowledge with you? Do they have a long list of positive references from other students?


Our experts in the field can help guide you through the process – both creative and technical – in image making.



NYC Digital Photography Workshops creates fun, yet informative, SEMI-PRIVATE and PRIVATE workshops that spark creativity and technical know-how with or without having the latest and greatest gear. We offer semi-private and private workshops on over 120 photography topics on everything from how to use your new DSLR, manual settings and composition to studio lighting, fashion and street photography. You will learn real-world photography techniques both in the studio and/or in the field.

NYCDPW leads themed Monthly Photo Walking Tours with its owner, Dawn M. Wayand, to exercise your skills, build your portfolio and make new friends in a more intimate group environment as well as Monthly Semi-Private “Learn and Shoot” Photo Walks with Instructor Ron Jautz where a topic for questions is set by the walk location. We provide outlets for your photography via occasional Group Exhibitions in various places such as SoHo, Chelsea, Lower East Side and more.

We aim to build your confidence as a photographer all while giving you the skills you need to succeed as a photographer. At NYCDPW, you will be part of a community of photographers, from novice to expert, where you can hone your craft. Our instructors, themselves working photographers, have walked in your shoes. They speak your language and understand your challenges. Yes, intuitive instruction that doesn’t cost an arm and a leg.


Register today…we look forward to helping YOU become the photographer YOU want to be!


Shoot. Learn. Become MORE Awesome.



Visit us at our Official Website at:

www.nycdpw.com



Already a member of NYC Digital Photography Workshops?

Please DO NOT sign up for THIS group as we offer the exact same classes and you will only receive duplicate emails and reminders for classes. Stick with NYC Digital Photography Workshops as you can no longer register for workshops on THIS Meetup website.


Not a member of NYC Digital Photography Workshops and interested in a wider variety of photography classes?


Please sign up for our SISTER group, NYC Digital Photography Workshops at www.nycdpw.com.
results.name: NYC Digital Photography Club

results.description:
The SMART Recovery Social & Reading Group (SR^2) is a closed, peer-led group for participants, facilitators, and friends of SMART Recovery who are familiar with the basics of SMART Recovery. The goals of this group are to delve into the tools and 4 Points of SMART Recovery more deeply and also to socialize outside of SMART meetings.

During reading meetups, we will focus on the study and application of the tools of SMART Recovery in detail, as well as read and apply other books, essays, and articles which can be directly related to the 4 Points of SMART Recovery, focus on lasting behavioral change, and which are science-based.  During social meetings, we'll do fun stuff. Hopefully, most meetings will contain a little learning and a little fun!

This is not a facilitated SMART Recovery meeting (for those, visit SMART NYC's page), but instead a reading and social group where any member can lead a social outing or a discussion around readings and topics related to the 4 Points of SMART. That means that you can organize and announce a meetup anytime you want. Want to drill ABCs? Schedule a meetup! Want to play ping pong with other SMARTies? Schedule a meetup! This group is what you make it to be!
results.name: SMART Recovery NYC Social & Reading Group

results.description:
This group is for anyone who wants to control their brain at the highest levels. Brain Body Mastery has two main components. One is mindfulness and other types of meditation, or low stimulus attention control, meaning focusing in a slow and quiet way. The other component is high stimulus attention control, which is about taking simple movements and brain exercises, and integrating them into complex, whole brain activities. They are usually done at faster speed and can demand a fair amount of physical and mental effort.

The following videos explain what this group is about better than any of what's written here, but scroll down if you'd like to read more of what's behind all this.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=9a8Mz5lWzjg

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=_uPWHXFEwy4

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=aNsNIqRVeDc&index=20&list=UUQThuzMvIkqC8wcVjTMjQFg 

Sign up for the FREE self-paced online course here: www.effortwise.info

The beauty of BrBd is that anyone can create new exercises. All it takes is curiosity and a little effort. Find two or more simple, separate activities and integrate them into one, and you grow your brain. Practice mindfulness or meditation, and you grow your brain. Even just practice being curious once in a while, and usually your brain grows.

The goal of BrBd is to be as in control of our conscious energy as possible. The implications reach far beyond just performing better at work or school. The more control you have over how your mind functions, the more quickly you can learn new skills, the more creative you can be, the more relaxed and present you can be, meaning you make better decisions. Aside from the longer term benefits, practicing just makes ya feel good.

For more on the subject of skill learning, here is a page from my website on how to master anything.
results.name: Brain Body Mastery

The Plan: By far the biggest challenge in starting a group like this is finding a suitable location. Fortunately Castle Bar & Grill (on Summer St) has agreed to give us access to their private room.

• Sound: No more listening to the Giants/Jets in a crowded bar! 

• Drink specials

topics.name: Ending the Isolation of Chronic Illness

results.description:
There are no scoliosis meetups or support groups in the NYC area to my knowledge. I have moderate scoliosis, and I decided to start one. If alcoholics have AA and drug addicts have NA, and there are support groups for a slew of other types of mental health and health issues, it's about time scoliosis got a support group of its own. We suffer too, don't we? Doesn't our condition impact our lives in significant ways, mentally and physically?

The only place where I read about the spiritual-psychological aspect of scoliosis was in a text written by Katharina Schroth, who founded the Schroth Method of scoliosis treatment in the early 20th Century (http://www.scoliosisjournal.com/content/6/1/17):

"Curvature of the spine, or scoliosis, is a precarious formal defect in terms of health, appearance, and the spiritual-psychological aspect. When attempting to help a scoliotic with this defect, we must not view the matter primarily from the mechanical standpoint, namely the malfunctioning body. For we have before us not a mechanical structure of bony levers and the muscles that move them, but rather an unfortunate person who has lost the form originally created for her and who cannot restore it by herself. With all scoliotic people, the cause probably lies partly in the mental realm. Envision what the expression "not in good form" means. Imagine the mental state of a child scolded by his mother. The psychic depression and loss of equilibrium are immediately visible in his abnormal bodily form. How wonderful the form of a little child's body is! What a victorious, natural, matter-of-fact nature he has in the representation of his Self, and in every movement and in all of his life statements.

However, let us observe a school class three or four years later. What has happened to these children? Almost all are missing their original sense of complete, untroubled comfort within. Many children have pronounced signs of suffering in their faces, and their depressed mental state finds expression in their bodies.

Why do gymnastic attempts to erect such a troubled child often fail completely? It is because they approach the child much too mechanically, much too much in the form of exercises, without first becoming familiar with his life difficulties, his unfulfilled needs, which to the adult may seem trivial. Straightening of the external person will only succeed when we can erect the inner person, open an avenue of hope, and allow him to breathe a sigh of relief." (Lehnert-Schroth, Christa, P.T. Three-Dimensional Treatment for Scoliosis, page 5)

Also, I must credit this video for inspiring me to move forward with this group: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=yGLzpt3caHw

Physical therapists can't help us deal with the mental issues that are getting in the way of our exercises, which in many cases renders the exercises useless. I believe a support group made up of other people with scoliosis is a crucial way of trying to address the psycho-spiritual contributors of this condition.
results.name: Scoliosis Support Group

results.description:
With the New Year, Identity House is forming a new group specific to the bisexual community. This is a new group focused on learning from one another and providing peer feedback on relevant topics that matter to you. We invite individuals of all genders to share their experiences and talk about bisexual life. With your participation, we can help build a foundational block on which the bisexual community can stand!


The emphasis of the group is peer support and the journey of finding yourself, loving yourself, navigating the process of discovering your sexual orientation and the understanding of what bisexuality means to each individual. This group will address the complexities and range of topics unique to the bisexual community and understanding of the importance of providing a space to explore the needs of the bisexual community.  Discussion topics may include bi phobia, bi erasure, bi privilege, sexual and gender fluidity, sexual health, access to quality mental health and health services, coming out, isolation, dating, relationships, work, gender identity, behavior, attraction, love, social constructs, inclusion and/or dis-inclusion in the LGBTQ community. The group will also help connect members to supports and share relevant and helpful books and resources.

Details:

The group is an 8 week commitment and will run in February 2015 on Wednesday nights from 6:30-8:30pm. There will be an orientation session to give all participants an opportunity to learn more about the group.

There's a suggested contribution to Identity House of $25 per session, however no one is turned away for financial reasons.

The orientation date for this group is February 4th, 2015.
To participate in this group, or if you have any questions, please contact Elisa via email at Elisacasinader@gmail.com or ihousegroups@gmail.com.

About the Organization: Identity House is a non-profit, all-volunteer organization that provides Peer Counseling, Group Support, and Therapy Referrals to members of the LGBTQ community who are struggling with issues of sexuality, alienation, relationships, and family. Learn more about Identity House at www.identityhouse.org/groups
results.name: IDH Bisexual Support Group Orientation 02/04/15 (NYC)

results.description:
The NY Sharing Economy Meetup connects the different groups and people in New York City interested in the sharing economy. It is intended for tech and non-tech alike, public and private, academics, founders, students, investors, city officials, visitors to NYC and more. We post sharing economy happenings across New York. 

The Sharing Economy often involves a shift towards interactions between peers and a more sustainable use of resources. It creates a new economic paradigm built on distributed networks of connected individuals and communities rather than on centralized institutions. (You may have heard people refer to it as collaborative consumption, the peer economy and the collaborative economy.) This new economic model is changing our daily lives, our communities, what it means to have a “job,” our cities, and the planet. 

The NY Sharing Economy Meetup is a collaborative organization driven by its members. All members are invited to suggest events that will enable the community to better understand the potential and challenges of this new economy, leverage new technologies, benefit from new opportunities, hear about cutting-edge research, experience new ways of sharing and much more. Examples of groups involved include Let's Collaborate!, New York University, OuiShare, Peers and more.

Note: events that are organized by external parties will be notified as 'PARTNER events'
results.name: NY Sharing Economy Meetup

results.description:
I started this group because I understand how important it is for us to know how to defend ourselves. Unfortunately, the world we live in is not as safe as it used to be, so it is important for us to be prepared in case something unfortunate happens.
This group is for anyone who is interested in learning real-life self defense. We will learn the self defense system taught in Taekwondo, along with Krav Maga, military combatives, and any other style that you may have trained in. All skill levels are welcome to join, we will all learn from each other in a fun and friendly environment. For those with little to no experience, we will start with the basics and increase complexity was we move along. For those with experience, be ready to get a good workout while furthering your arsenal of skills. We will meet on Tuesdays and Thursdays from 7:00pm to 8:00pm, but if we feel good, we can definitely go beyond 8:00pm. The head instructor will be Vinicius Raposa, who has over a decade of experience in various martial arts. Sir Raposa is an Internationally ranked Black Belt in Taekwondo, with unique self-defense experience developed from his time training with the Brazilian Marines at the Escola Naval, Rio de Janeiro and being the highest ranked Kombato practitioner in the United States. You will be in good hands.

-Dates: Every Tuesday and Thursday

-Times: 7:00pm - 8:00pm

-Location: Newark, NJ

-First meeting is FREE

862-305-0369 (call/text)
973-901-0860 (Portuguese)

results.description:
My name is Camille, and I am the best selling author of "How to Lose Water Weight", "Bye Bye Thunder Thighs", and "The Thigh Gap Hack". I love all things fitness related and this group is a manifestation of one of my all time favorite interests - experimenting with new exercises and workouts! (Please click on any of the links to check out my books)


ABOUT THIS GROUP

Your social calendar just got a lot more interesting! When you join Free Fitness and Beauty Events - NYC meet up group, you'll get first wind of the latest beauty and fitness related parties, socials, in store events, launches, classes / workshops all happening in this great city of ours for absolutely zero dollars (and from time to time very steep discounts)!


 Sure you could comb the web for *some of these events and attend all by your lonesome, but going to these workout classes and beauty events stag, while common, kind of sucks. How can you enjoy your free cocktails, hors d'oeuvres and tunes or share your sense of accomplishment at completing a butt kicking working, if you don't know anyone else at the event because your friends are stuck at work / are too lame to go out / hate anything that doesn't involve drinking / or you're new in town?

Having been to many of these fitness and beauty events I see participants who share so much in common barely connecting with each other because the social aspect isn't fostered or organized - (not that they're to blame.. it's enough work throwing together and hosting these things!)


That's where being a member of this meet up comes in handy! 

Because now you'll have a group of people who share your passion for all things beauty / fashion / fitness attending the events and your great meet up host to facilitate the introductions and conversations. You'll also get to discover and experience dance/fitness classes and be exposed to new beauty brands that you may become a lifelong fan of!


PLEASE NOTE: 

While we plan to organize many of our own exclusive events for members (the more members the more pull we have - so invite your friends!), we will also be sharing events that are open to the public and require RSVP's to get in. 

I hope you'll see how awesome our group is and the immense value we have to offer.
results.name: Free Fitness & Beauty Events

results.description:
Career design is about building a bridge between where you are today and where you want to be. It's about creating work that distinguishes you from the crowd, and lets you to ladder up to the kind of job you want—at a company that affords its employees autonomy and ownership over their work. These companies are known as responsive organizations.

Responsive Career Design helps motivated people build the skills they need to operate and thrive when given the freedom to control their own work. Responsive orgs move faster, make more money, keep employees happier, and attract the best talent. There are more of these companies every year—Starbucks, WL Gore, Spotify, Valve, Tesla—but they're not going to train you to be an innovator.

RCD is a crash course in how people at the fastest, most innovative companies think about problems, plan their careers, and make themselves into assets. How do you become a self-directed worker? What skills let you execute projects effectively across non-technical disciplines? 

The source material for this Meetup is drawn from thought leader interviews and research on areas that impact career advancement most acutely: things like communication, self-instruction, storytelling, and on-the-spot thinking. The contents of this meetup are also available through our email newsletter.

We are a branch of TheResponsiveOrg, an open + non-profit community underwritten by companies like Microsoft and IBM.

Email me if you have questions! --Chris (organizer) cdannen@gmail.com
results.name: Responsive Org Career Design

results.description:
Calling everyone interested in standing up against hate, strengthening ties of communication and cooperation between Muslims and Jews in New York City! 

The New York City Muslim Jewish Solidarity Committee (NYMJSC) was originally initiated by the Foundation for Ethnic Understanding. The committee is a grassroots group of Muslim and Jewish activists, leaders and community members committed to working together. 

The NYC Muslim-Jewish Solidarity Committee is locally organized and has three focus areas:

- Standing Up for Each Other: Muslims and Jews taking joint public stands against hate crimes, incitement or discrimination directed at either community
- Learning About Each Other: Counteract Islamophobia and anti-Semitism within our respective communities
- Organizing and Publicizing: cultural, festive and social service events in order to deepen communal ties and allow individual Jews and Muslims to connect on a personal level

The committee will meet monthly to plan for different types of events and more frequently when crises between the two communities in NYC arise.

Please check out our Facebook group here: https://www.facebook.com/pages/NYC-Muslim-Jewish-Solidarity-Committee/816752598371675?fref=ts
results.name: NYC Muslim-Jewish Meetup

results.description:
Do you enjoy reading the Tarot? Are you studying the Tarot? This group is for people who are seeking to increase their tarot skills for their self-development and for divination. We will explore ways to develop our intuitive reading skills through the use of decks and spreads. We will share the many ways we each use tarot. The goal is to form a group of  about 6-8 core members who meet on Friday nights from about 7pm until about 9pm at least once or twice every month. It would be great to work from shared texts such as The Absolute Beginner's Guide to Tarot,   Power Tarot or the Tarot Bible or Tarot for Yourself.

Ideas for future meetups include:

•  Practicing card spreads from one card up to twelve cards.

• Using comparative tarot spreads to deepen understanding of each card.

• Speed reading sessions during which members perform brief private readings for one another

• Exercises from books such as 365 Tarot Activities by Deanna Anderson or The Tarot Activity Book by Andy Matzner, or Tarot for Every Day by Cait Johnson.

This is a group for anyone interested in Reiki, Energy Healing, Meditation and Self-Study with the purpose of attain a better understanding of the meaning of our lives, how energy or Chi moves inside of us and all around us, so we can walk the Path towards the Awakening of Consciousness or Liberation.

Reiki:
I provide 45 minutes personal Reiki Healing sessions for $25. Session includes cleansing in Sage, crystal healing, music therapy, aromatherapy, and healing with hands. You will have to call or message me to make an appointment.

Meditation:

Our free group guided Meditation will occur once a week. A little lecture and introduction to the practice will be discuss for about 45min, then we will start our meditation practice with calming the mind using Pranayama or breathing exercises, soft  music or mantra, and finally silent meditation for 30min.

The purpose of our Meditation is to quiet the mind so we can listen to our internal Being or Guru and be instructed by him.  Other times, we will seat in meditation to study ourselves in our daily routine and analyze our thoughts, feelings and actions so we can improve ourselves and become a more loving human beings trying to eliminate all those negative elements that we carry inside that cause us suffering.

Hope to meet you soon!


Pia

Agile Testing Alliance (ATA) is a non-profit Agile testing community and certification organization. It is a global alliance of visionary industry leaders, prominent authors, leading educational institutions and testing evangelists who are passionate about proliferation of agile in testing. ATA’s mission is to grow agile testing awareness, practices, acceptance and to create a learning roadmap specifically in agile testing space. ATA helps agile practitioner to identify the milestones that can be evaluated, certified and recognized.

ATA provides platform for local communities to get together & share ideas on agile testing/automation through local chapters across multiple countries & cities. Greater New York meet-up group is created for professional in NY, NJ, CT and PA area. We invite all Agile practitioner to come forward and spread awareness about Agile testing in their local areas through hosting events. 

We plan to host seminars/workshops on Agile Testing & Agile automation with you and for you. 

So let's do it.!!!

results.description:
Firstly, if you are a writer and would like to have pages read, please contact me so I can book you – my ballpark is 4 writers per meetup - there are limited spaces as this is my personal home.

The evening will go something like this:

Approximately four writers will bring 10 or so pages of original writing, generally feature or short scripts. Please bring enough hard copies of your material for each part you need to cast – and don’t forget to cast the narrator – this is often the most important part! Please highlight the lines for each given character- it will make it much easier for the actors.

During the first 15 minutes or so the writers will cast the parts to any actors (or non-shy writers) who are attending. Writers, feel free to give the actors any general notes, caveats, special pronunciations, contexts, etc, but try not to go full Kubrick, as this is a cold reading!

Then we’ll do the reading (the fun, without-a-net part) and then we’ll give a few minutes of feedback. Important: the level of feedback will be directed by the writer. In other words, the writer is invited to ask for general feedback (“Hey, what do you think?”), specific feedback (‘Do we believe Julie when she tells Sam that she wants to keep the baby, regardless of the consequences???”), or no feedback at all (which is perfectly acceptable – just hearing it in the room and seeing if people are laughing and crying in the right places is often enough.)

Bathroom/refreshment break halfway through, then we’ll rock it out till ten or so.

I’ll have some provisions on hand, but please feel free to bring a bottle of wine/pellegrino/pringles/artisanal cheese/your grandmother’s fresh baked cookies, etc…
results.name: NYC Screenwriter & Actor Workshop

results.description:
Programming 101: Pen and Paper Coding is an introductory programming class taught using pen and paper only in NYC. 

Our method helps prevent any distractions that occur when using a computer too early on in the learning process, while students focus on getting a solid grasp of the fundamentals of computer programming. 

The goals of the course are ambitious, and the curriculum covers a lot of the materials taught in a typical “Programming 101” course at computer science departments around the world.  

The course consists of 5 sessions, meeting once a week for five consecutive weeks. Group size is between 4-8 students + an experienced instructor. The course fee is $399, and includes all 5 sessions, video recordings of each class, as well as a textbook written by the main instructor specifically for this course. The course is held at Impact Hub (394 Broadway @ Walker St) (nyc.impacthub.net).

Join this Meetup group to stay informed about our courses and visit www.penpapercoding.com for more information!

Come, join us for a dynamic programming class that delivers!

The Pen and Paper Coding Team
results.name: The Pen and Paper Coding Class

results.description:
China-US International Trade Networking is a bridge to bring Chinese manufacturers and US business owners together, a platform to share relevant experience & knowledge, make friends and meet potential business partners!

Background:

International trade has flourished over the years because of the many benefits it has offered to different countries across the globe. China, as the world’s biggest exporter, and the United States, as the world’s biggest importer, are two major trade players. However, due to language and geographical issues, there still has been a gap between U.S. and China’s businessmen/businesswomen in terms of information symmetry and efficiency of resource integration.

We understand that the businessmen/businesswomen in the U.S. are eager to find accessible sources of high quality products with lower cost, and at the same time, a number of giant manufacturers in China are looking for opportunities to expand their global sales networks and sell their products in a more cost-efficient way.

Our Mission:

We believe that the trade between both sides could be organized in a more ACCESSIBLE and EFFICIENT way, and therefore we set up this meet up to help you find your best business partners from China.

Industries Included:

HOLIDAY SUPPLIES/COSTUMES, GIFTS, TOYS, APPAREL, SHOES, EYEWEAR FRAMES, GARDEN EQUIPMENTS, STEEL, etc.

We are open to people/companies from other industries too!

Our Advantage:

- RESOURCE INTEGRATION (With our strong connection with competitive Chinese manufacturers, we could help you quickly identify and match your best-fit business partners from China!)

- NETWORK EXPANSION (Meet up with people have different background but share the same interest!)

- TECHNICAL EXPERTISE (We have a group of experts with a diverse background!)

If you wish to empower your future business backed by reliable manufacturers from China, do not hesitate to take the chance, and JOIN US right now!
results.name: China & US International Trade Networking

Our family of small business groups has over 7,200 members, inside and outside meetup, and still growing!  

We are a community-led organization supported by its members, who range from students reading business books in their dorm rooms, to entrepreneurs looking to become the next  Bill Gates, to investors in search of the next big thing, to top business experts, to established CEOs at some of New York’s top companies.

Have you had a dream of running your own business with passion? 
Have you ever felt unappreciated, underpaid or even worse not enjoying going to work?
Are you bored at work?
Do you hate your Boss?
Do you feel over-skilled at work?

If you answered yes to any of the above questions then this group is definitely for you!

The purpose of this group is to ignite passion and hope, inspire and support members to create and share their dreams so they know the direction they'd like to go as well as how to proceed. You'll become aware of the freedom on so many levels that you can create when you begin to focus your energies on your dream.  You'll have the support from the amazing team of members that want to succeed with you!

We have many functions such as social networking, interactive lectures, discussions, online meetups, brainstorming sessions, round table meetings, think tanks, experts panels and informative educational webinars. Throughout these Meetups you'll learn the amazing techniques, tools, and processes to build momentum.

Are you ready to decide once in for all that you deserve more.  Are you ready to learn and implement these amazing concepts into your life so you too can be on the road to freedom? Aren't you worth it?

Come join us!... Remember in NYC is not what you know, but who you know! 

HOPE TO SEE YOU AT OUR NEXT EVENT!

Organizers: Robert Kandel. Entrepreneur and Roger Kuperways, Ph.D. Life long Entrepreneur, investor, and former adjunct Professor of Entrepreneurship at New York University.

results.description:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=bHjjkXZn0x0

Psychology Dinners is another social innovation experiment created by Glen Brauer inspired from the ongoing success of Philosophy Dinners (PhilosophyDinners.org). Click here to view some feedback from previous Philosophy Dinners events held in cities around the world.

This group is for people who value fun and engaging discussions with intelligent, open-minded and friendly people. This Meetup group was created as part of a non-profit global initiative using practical psychology to bring together strangers and build community.


When will the first event take place?

This depends on how long it takes for members to join this Meetup group.  Typically a Meetup group requires at least 30 members in order to get a turnout of at least 6 people.


What will be the topic for the first event?

I will be sending out a poll to decide that once enough members join this group.


The format for these events will be very similar to Philosophy Dinners:

- open-minded individuals who are as intelligent as they are friendly

- 1 thought-provoking topic provided in advance so you have time to ponder it

- Food for Thought videos provided in advance of event 

- events are held in a charming restaurant

- restaurant is close to public transportation

- 6 people at each table (so everyone has a chance to speak)

- 1 discussion facilitator at each table (members take turns being facilitators)

- thought-provoking questions (discussion notes) are provided by Glen Brauer to the facilitators in order to stimulate the discussions.


There are no membership fees but a small fee is required when signing up for events which goes towards Meetup costs, the time required to research and produce the discussions notes, booking restaurant reservations, scheduling the events, and coordinating the facilitators.

If this sounds interesting to you then click "Join Us" on the top-right of this screen then RSVP to events when they are posted. Members receive email notifications when new events are scheduled.


The Psychology Dinners Facebook Group

results.description:
We believe that programming languages, like spoken languages, require a close-knit user community in order to thrive. Scala Stammtisch is founded to bring people together who want to learn, share, and improve functional programming in Scala.

According to Wikipedia, “A Stammtisch is an informal group meeting held on a regular basis, and also the usually large, often round table around which the group meets. A Stammtisch is not a structured meeting, but rather a friendly get-together.”

We are the Scala Stammtisch of NYC, and we invite you to the table.

Format

While most technical meetups optimize for one-to-many communication, Scala Stammtisch aims for 15-to-15 discussion of technical topics.

We discuss one topic in a month’s worth of weekly meetups. Three discussions of the same material repeat on a fixed schedule each week; members should plan to attend only one of these. A fourth gathering takes place in an even less structured, and potentially raucous, setting.

The first 3 meetups for a topic will have an RSVP limit of 15. We will take attendance and no-shows will not be tolerated in the group, though members may change their RSVP with impunity from the time of the announcement up until 12pm of the day of the meetup.
results.name: Scala Stammtisch

topics.name: Small Groups - Book Club, Discuss Issues

results.description:
"Conversations around timeless articles from weeklies and dailies and search for intelligent life among neighbors" is for people who read serious journalism in search for “the best, which has been thought and said”, and want to discuss their finds with likeminded readers.

This is an article discussion meetup for people whose main interest are books. Why article rather than book discussion group then? A book discussion group is not for people who take books seriously, i.e. “have a sense of purpose for reading” (Daniel Bell). They cannot take a detour from the reading path defined by their own questions and interests even for sake of finding people they speak the same language with. An article discussion group allows finding people of the same quality as a book group while making much lesser demand on your reading time.

A serious magazine or newspaper seems to be the only place where you can find intelligent life in public space. Good periodicals might be the only link between people who think. This is the reason for creating the meetup.

This group is for readers who from time to time come across a fascinating article and want to discuss it with others both for better understanding of things and for pleasure of being with people who share your interests.

I am talking about an occasional outstanding article with eye-opening analysis or a review of a great book (just published or classic), not about daily reporting.

For sake of describing this group I’d like to restate the obvious - a few of many things that one may get from a good newspaper if he goes past news:
1. Understanding political world we live in - insightful analysis of major issues of politics – both domestic and foreign;
2. Opportunity to hear people with greater wisdom and knowledge than your own (in our interactions in person we are usually limited to people of our own level);
3. Invaluable tips for continuing study of Humanities on your own;
4. Knowledge for dealing with earthly problems of our lives.

It is easy to miss and never discover articles and tips about books that would be of most interest to you or even “change your life” because there are too many worthy newspapers and magazines for one person to keep up with. It is another reason for this meetup.

Articles will not be limited to current ones. Selection criteria are topic and quality - publication date does not matter – we will be discussing pieces that are “timeless”.
A sample list of articles that follows this description will give you an idea of what kind of things we may discuss. People with a different range of interests who like the idea of this group may want to create meetups that reflect their interests.

Technically this group is limited to discussion of articles, but in reality it should allow discussing any topic that may interest you because over years your favorite newspapers and magazines most likely have had an article on anything you can ever think of.

Periodicals do have online forums, but they are a poor ersatz for a conversation in person and a poor tool for selecting people to talk to (before joining this meetup you will be offered a few questions to determine if the group matches your interests). Unfortunately there are no gathering places for those who want to meet people to discuss works of journalism. This group is designed to serve a role of such place.

Basics on how the group will operate
1. The leader will select an article (or a few) for a discussion using recommendations of the group and his own findings and post the selection approximately two weeks before a meeting. In addition to discussing articles we may want to share tips about articles and books that we find interesting.
2. We will restrict freedom of speech by a 2-3 min. limit per person per comment except instances when the group wants to hear more. Taking numbers might be another good idea.
3. Initial plan is to meet once a month – most likely we will be meeting on Mondays.
4. Meetings will be held in Manhattan.

Sample articles
List of abbreviations:
NYT - New Your Times
WSJ – Wall Street Journal
FT – Financial Times

0. The Truth About Our Libertarian Age By Mark Lilla - newrepublic.com June 17, 2014
1. The Slow Lane - It really is good to talk By Harry Eyres - FT, June 08, 2013
2. The Slow Lane - Peaks and Promenades By Harry Eyres - FT, September 05, 2014
3. The Slow Lane - Lessons in love from the ancients By Harry Eyres - FT, January 10, 2014
4. Daniel Bell (1919–2011) APRIL 7, 2011 Mark Lilla at nybooks.com
5. No Faith in Progress - Jonathan Franzen’s ‘Kraus Project’ - NYT Book Review, October 11, 2013
6. The Story Of a Lifetime; An ordinary German--and compulsive diarist--lives through Weimar, the Nazi era and the Cold War - WSJ, March 17, 2011
7. The Dangers of Certainty - A Lesson From Auschwitz By SIMON CRITCHLEY NYT (The Stone opinion series) February 2, 2014
8. I'm With Stupide - 'Bouvard and Pécuchet,' by Gustave Flaubert - NYT Book Review, January 22, 2006
9. The Examined Life By JONATHAN LEAR - NYT, October 25, 1998
10. Net wisdom - FT, February, 16, 2013
11. Lost and Found - Left in Nepal at 3, Daja Takes Decades To Find Out Why; After Being Raised by Monks, He Makes His Way to U.S.; 'Mother Where Are You'; A Leap From a Window Ledge - WSJ, March 15, 2005
12. Leo Strauss: The European By Mark Lilla, The New York Review of Books, Oct 21, 2004
13. Neocon or Not – Review of 'Reading Leo Strauss,' by Steven Smith – NYT Book review, June 25, 2006
14. “Salvation at the Forum” (The first Robert Bresson’s retrospective in this country in 14 years) – WSJ, January 5, 2012
15. The Crisis of American Self-Government; Harvey Mansfield on the 2012 election, and the real cost of entitlements - WSJ, December 1, 2012
16. Stoppard in Moscow - moreintelligentlife.com, November 26, 2007
17. Don't be an idiot. Read newspapers. BY TUNKU VARADARAJAN - OpinionJournal.com, April 30, 2002
18. Bad News - By RICHARD A. POSNER – NYT, July 31, 2007
19. "The Meaningfulness of Lives" – NYT (The Stone opinion series) September 11, 2011
20. Happiness, Beyond the Data By Gary Gutting - NYT (The Stone opinion series) April 10, 2013
21. When Socrates Met Phaedrus/ Eros in Philosophy - NYT (The Stone opinion series) November 3, 2013
22. "The Education of an Iranian Revolutionary" - Interview with Shirin Ebadi (Borrowing language from The Good Soldier Švejk this is another evidence that all great revolutions in history of humankind are worth shit) – WSJ, April 4, 2011
23. An Iranian Storyteller’s Personal Revolution – NYT, July 1, 2012
24. Prole Models by Charles Murray – WSJ, February 6, 2001
25. Bookshelf - The Imperialists and Their Attributes - THE RULING CASTE By David Gilmour – WSJ, February 23, 2006
26. Ian Smith, Defiant Symbol of White Rule in Africa, Is Dead at 88 – NYT, November 21
27. Merely Departed - Obits at This School Aren't to Die For; Dead King's College Alumni Can Expect a Roasting; 'Smut for its Own Sake' – WSJ, October 31, 2005
28. Notable & Quotable - Joseph Schumpeter writing about ‘the intellectual's righteous indignation about the wrongs of capitalism’ (‘Capitalism, Socialism and Democracy’) – WSJ, October 29, 2012
29. Herta Muller’s Literature, Born of Isolation – NYT, May 18, 2012
30. Why Won't They Listen? – review of The Righteous Mind by Jonathan Haidt - NYT, March 3, 2012
results.name: Conversations around timeless articles from weekliesNdailies

results.description:
The purpose of this group is share resources and practices so that we can nurture ourselves so that we have the joy and strength we need to live courageously, and so nurture others and the earth.  The group is led by LoraKim Joyner, wildlife veterinarian and minister (that's me).  My goal is to grow our numbers and commitment so that we can derive pleasure and joy from this beautiful earth, and so care for what we may, while we can. Other people and species need us to be as whole and as powerful as we can. The Conservationist Way is one pathway for this deep living and giving.  When we meet, I will facilitate specific practices and discussions to nurture ourselves so that we can nourish all of nature.

Please join if you wish to live more strongly connected to life around you, and if you wish to do something for others, such as addressing climate change, loss of biodiversity, extinction, or poverty.  If you arent' sure what you can do with limits on your energy, time and resources, do not hestiate and come join us. There are so many ways to preserve beauty on this earth, even in your daily routine.  

Everyone is welcome, because the earth needs us to be conservationists.

What is a conservationist?  It is you, or can be, for.....

A conservationist is one who increases knowledge and awareness of nature, and uses that understanding to save themselves and the world.

To find out more, go here.

Let us join one another so that our experiences and compassion can guide the way on the path of conservation and joy.
results.name: The Conservationist's Way: A Nurture Nature Group

results.description:
The PMP Exam Prep Network Meetup: 5 Boroughs/NYC Area  is for people preparing for the Project Management Institute's (PMI) Project Management Professional (PMP) application and certification test

This MeetUp is to collaborate in studying and sharing resources with other PMP exam preppers.

The MeetUp group is designed to: 

Arrange in-person study sessions (parallel study, collaborative study, etc.) 

• Parallel study: 2 or more PMP Exam Preppers meeting to study same place/time, but not necessarily collaborating (side by side study)

• Collaborative study: 2 or more PMP Exam Preppers meeting to study together 

Share PMP:

• Application preparation resources

• Study plans

• Study aids 

• Other PMP application/exam preparation support resources

Connect to any ongoing PMI and/ PMI NYC study groups/events/resources

ONGOING MEETINGS

Members can arrange meetings and announce them here on the MeetUp.  Confirm the MeetUp time and location in the days leading up to it and the day of.  This way we can grow the network and number of study session options throughout the boroughs/NYC area.

Study sessions/MeetUps should be held in public places with free wifi with excellent, reliable internet connectivity.  The best places will have the table space to accommodate members and studying and sitting for an extended period.  Libraries, community-based coworking/meeting spaces; establishments with a la carte beverage/foods with no waiter/table service and no tipping preferred (Starbucks/cafes, etc).  

Meetings: We plan to hold at least one in-person meeting per week and encourage members to host in-person study sessions at locations/times convenient to them, if they would like more options.  

Connect & Share: We will use platforms such as email, list serve, file sharing and group SMS messaging to facilitate resource sharing and setting up study sessions.

If you would like to join the PMP Exam Prep NYC area Network, send a message with:

• a description of where you are in the PMP application and exam preparation process

• your planned timeline for submitting the application and taking the PMP exam

• where you would like to have PMP study session

• resources you can share that can be of help to others in this Network.
results.name: PMP Exam Prep Network Meetup: 5 Boroughs/NYC Area

results.description: Being a black parent, especially of a black boy, comes with the added onus of having to protect your child. — We need to continue have “the talk” with our sons. That someone that looks like him get killed every 28 hours, that will likely imprison him by his mid-thirties if he doesn't get his high school diploma, that is more than twice as likely to suspend him from school than a white classmate. For black parents, I asked: What rules, warnings, survival tactics are you giving your children as you raise them? For black youth: What have you been taught? What did you learn on your own? And for everyone: What would you have told Michael Brown before he left the house that afternoon?

The city has a thriving network of Australians working in the screen industry and we intend to put on a series of educational events to help build their industry contacts and support their working knowledge and skills.”

results.description:
Do you like to dance? Are you interested in Scottish or Celtic music and culture? Would you like to meet great people, get some exercise, and have fun? Then come dance with us! Beginners are welcome; you don't need to bring a partner; you don't need any special costume, just soft-soled shoes with no heels and clean soles (to keep the dance floor clean -- you can change into them when you arrive).

Scottish country dancing is a social dance form where you dance with a partner in a set of couples, somewhat like square dancing or contra dancing. In each dance you will do a set of patterns using skipping steps, which are taught and practiced during the weekly classes. There are several dance parties throughout the year, as well as more formal balls in which dancers from all across the region come together and dance to live music. Each session has a break for tea and snacks during which you can rest and socialize. The dancers are very friendly and will always help you out if you get confused or forget what to do next.

Here's an example of what it looks like (and another).
results.name: Westchester Scottish Country Dance Society

results.description:
INTERTWINE IS AN IDEA. The idea that wine is a social drink meant to be shared among good company. By sharing, we connect ideas, interests, form friendships and professional partnerships. Whether socially or professionally, we intertwine high-quality company with high-quality wine. Intertwine is becoming a sphere of influence among the sophisticated and the educated of New York City. Intertwine is defining the first-ever wine scene in the city that leads the world in business and pleasure. If you want to be a part of the New York wine scene, and to intertwine with all types of individuals from all genres, you must sign up to get invited to an Intertwine event.

This meetup is for people who appreciate wine and who are looking to meet others in a socially friendly atmosphere. We encourage people to get out of their comfort zone to make new friends and to simulate commerce when possible. We are a community of wine lovers but we can do much more to help each other professionally. 

We will be hosting 3 types of events:

Wine Tastings: We will be giving samples of various Italian wines at different wine shops and restaurants in New York City. Some tastings will be free and some will require a fee. 

Wine Dinners: We'll be hosting wine dinners at various restaurants and chic venues in New York that will focus on optimum wine and food pairings. These events will be exclusive and small capacity. Once an event is fully reserved, we won't be able to accept anyone else. 

Social Wine Events: These events will be social and professional networking in nature with a wine theme in the backdrop. These will be our largest events and will take place in restaurants and venues in the city. 

We are building a community of high-quality people; working professionals, entrepreneurs, business owners are all welcome. Casual wine drinkers, wine beginners, and connoisseurs are all welcome.

results.description:
Asian Society and Culture in Westchester, New York

This group is for Aisans, people interested in Asian culture professionally and those interested in Asian languages.


The age of this groups members is 20-40.

The group meets in Westchester, New York and occassionally in Manhattanb, New York.  We are going to have events in all major Westchester cities.  This includes;  White Plains, Yonkers, and Tarrytown.

Asian Society and Culture in Westchester, New York has activities for singles and families.  If an activity is for families it says (FAMILY ACTIVITY) on posting.

This is a meetup group for people in Westchester County, New York that are interested in Asian Culture and activities that are typically Asian.  Asian Culture of Westchester, New York is a New York group about Asian community and studies.  We engage in monthly activities, the majority of which are in White Plains, New York.  We do have activities planned at other Westchester, New York locations.    At least 3 times a year we are going to have an activity in Manhattan, New York.  The activities of the group are either based on Asian culture or are social events exclusively for people interested in Asian culture.  

You need to apply for membership into this group. This is to keep out unwanted people.  We do not want people joining this group simply to meet foreign women, or who are not deeply into Asian culture, but seek meager entertainment.  This group is for people who are members of the Asian community.  You do not have to be Asian to join this group.  This is a group for people who are seriously interested in Asian culture and Asians!  We do no permit people who are voyeurs or who do not take the groups subject matter seriously.  Please do not let this discourage you.  This is a security measure to allow us to have a high quality and more productive group.


The activities of this group include:

Asian Bar Nights

Asian Nightclub Nights

Asian Social Networking Events

Asian History Discussions

Asian Religious Discussions

Chinese New Year Celebrations

The Spring Blossom Festival

Kabuki Theatre

Karaoke

Asian Movie Viewing Nights

Visiting Koreatown.

Visiting Flushings Chinatown

Visiting Manhattan's Chinatown and Canal Street.

Visiting Manhattan, New York fir Asian culture events.

Visiting Buddhist Temples and Shrines

Lectures on Asian Culture

Asian Language Exchanges

The group meets every month.

Tet Celebration

The group is lead by a native New Yorker, who is a Buddhist/Taoist instructor and martial arts teacher.  The organizer is also an active member of the Asian community in; New York and Hawaii.  The organizer enjoys; Asian clubs in New York, karaoke, surfing, and the arts.


Thank you,

Erik

The Asian Culture in Westchester New York Meetup Organizer
results.name: Asian Society and Culture in Westchester, New York Meetup

The Young Professionals Network of Fairfield County (YPN) is an initiative of The Business Council of Fairfield County that for professionals in their 20s and 30s who work and live throughout the region. Our job is to enrich the community by providing business, networking, and volunteer opportunities to support your career development, and to promote the qualities that make Fairfield County a great place for young professionals to live, work, and put down roots.

Since 2009, YPN has connected Fairfield County's young professionals with the region's business leadership; looked at some of the most exciting places throughout the county; volunteered at clothing drives, urban farms, and more to give back to the local community; and partnered with local business and other young professional organizations to develop and celebrate tomorrow's leaders, today. We look forward to seeing you soon at our events. Welcome to the Young Professionals Network of Fairfield County!

results.description:
(best viewed in desktop version).

A sketch group for naturist/nudist male artists where artists take turns posing for each other. Our focus is to draw the male figure and depict masculinity. When both the model and the artist are similarly naked, they are on equal footing, encouraging an openness and camaraderie not found in traditional drawing groups. Website http://mndgny.com

Criteria to join this group:

• individuals who primarily present themselves with masculine or male features

• visual artist (mandatory, any level from beginner to experienced), all non-smelly mediums except photography. Since we pose for each other, we don't accept guys who only want to pose. 

• comfortable being nude with fellow artists, willing to pose naked for other artists

• friendly, respectful

• photo in profile (headshot/face preferred)

• be local or have plans to travel to NYC


Additional details and rules:

•  We meet about 3 times per month, usually a Tuesday, a Thursday and one weekend day. Please check the schedule.

•  Multiple locations. Address given to members only.

•  RSVP via Meetup only.

•  Fee: $15 cash. Credit cards accepted for advance payment. Use link in the event description.

•  Arrive 15-30 minutes before event start time. Everyone sets up.

•  Overall session time is 3 hours. It’s a 2-1/2 hour drawing session with social time before.  Everyone cleans up after.

•  Full nudity of all participants is required for the duration of the session. Tuesday venue: footwear is recommended when not on the model stand.

•  All artists should be willing to pose on the model stand. First-timers are not required to pose. There are usually more artists than posing slots so not everyone will pose. Sign up for single/duo/3-person poses. Erotic/sensual poses on the model stand welcome.

•  Creating interesting poses is the group’s collective responsibility. Each artist should think about his possible poses in advance while the other artists should offer friendly suggestions. 

•  There is no instruction. Bring all your own materials, drawing boards, portable easels, etc. There is a sink available for rinsing your brushes.

•  Artists are encouraged to share their work by taping their work to the wall as the session progresses. We will photograph drawings to post on social media. We want this to be social (not formal). While we want to improve our artwork, we want to have fun doing it. Don't forget to take your drawings home with you!

•  Photography of persons without permission is prohibited.

•  Sexual activity prohibited anywhere in the building; this is not a hook-up event.

•  Bring a towel or sit on your shirt. Please be hygienic.

•  Bring a backpack or bag to put your stuff in (wallet, phone, etc). MNDGNY or the venues are not responsible for lost or stolen items.

•  First-time artists to sign a release to publish photos of their artwork done during session on the group’s sites and social media. Confidentiality will be respected. It's okay to decline but still fill out a form.


Priority RSVP and "no-show" policy (new 7/27/2015):

To reward regular attendance and reduce “no-shows”, we are implementing priority RSVPs similar to airline priority seating. New events will open to RSVP according to group (Goldstar, Fan, all). Emails will go out according to group. Click here for details.


Volunteer roles (this is a group effort):

• Bring bring snacks/refreshments to share (optional). Wine, seltzer, cheese, crackers provided.

• Photographing artwork

• Music (bring your device, your playlist, hook into the sound system)

• Thinking of interesting poses – all artists

• Setting up and cleaning up


FAQ:

•  I don't know how to draw. Is there any instruction? There is no instruction, but beginner artists are welcome to try us out as long as you have the interest and make the effort to draw. There will be special sessions with instruction from a naked teacher; please check the schedule.

•  I've never been to a naked event before. What's it like? We're a friendly bunch and like most naturists, nonjudgmental. We have a wide range of ages and body types. Everyone gets fully undressed (except possibly for footwear) after checking in/paying the fee and stays naked for the entire session. It's quite natural and relaxed.

•  Do I need to bring my own supplies? What is provided? You must bring all your own supplies (paper/pads, pencils, drawing boards, easels, etc). Most guys draw on pads on their laps. The studio provides chairs, and running water.

•  I've never posed before. Many of our members had never posed before joining our group. We're a friendly and relaxed group, so no need to stress out about it. It might be easier to pose together with someone else to start. We have 2-person poses to accommodate this. Not everyone poses every session. We have about 10-15 posing slots per session and we usually have about 20 attendees. There is a sign up sheet for poses (varying lengths 5-20mins) at the beginning of each session and guys sign up for what they want to do.

•  Who keeps the drawings that I posed for? Each artist keeps his own drawings. The model can ask for/trade/buy other artists' drawings.

•  What's the sexual energy of the group like? The sexual energy level varies quite a bit depending on who shows up.

•  What's an erotic pose? Poses are up to each artist posing. They can be classical, athletic, dance-like, sexy, etc. Erotic poses can simulate sexual acts like masturbating, etc. We're open-minded but remember that some artists don't like the model(s) to move too much. We're a naked drawing group where erotic poses welcome but not required. Try to find the right balance. It's not a performance piece. Each venue has different guidelines on what's acceptable - this will be announced before each session.

•  What if I get an erection? Erections are natural and are welcome. However, when you're socializing or supposed to be drawing, masturbating is not okay.

•  Is this a gay group? Many of our members are gay, but we are open to men regardless of sexual orientation. In fact, we don't talk about it much. As you can see by the questions above, some artists create poses that are homoerotic so you should be comfortable with that.

Organized by Shungaboy

Our social media:

Our Website: http://mndgny.com...

Our Twitter: https://twitter.com/M...

Our Facebook Page: https://www.facebook....

Our Wordpress Blog: http://mndgny.wordpre...


Updated 7/28/2015

results.description:
When the schedule says a start time it doesn't mean you have to be there at the specified start time. you can arrange to come at any point from start time to 8 pm. Saturday & Sunday activities are available all day long not just starting at 9 am. Just say you will be attending for the day and tell me what time you plan to show up than watch for my confirmation reply. If you have my text # already you can contact me via text as well but please if you can also show attendance on this site if you can't I totally understand it can get tedious signing in at this site for every class. I've experienced it myself attending other people's meetups. I'm Rob by name. Adrenalhigh Rob or Sergeant Pain if you prefer. :-) Now for the information about this training.

This group will include outdoor martial arts training and outdoor social sports in NYC & BK as well as indoor martial arts training on rainy and cold days in Brooklyn.

All training and sports will be on a first request basis. Whomever requests whichever activity on any given day / time is what we will do.

Tennis & Paddle Ball 

For tennis I will bring 100 balls and we will do drills first than play a game than review our weaknesses and drill our weaknesses. There will be no charge for this unless you need to borrow a racquet than it will be a $5 charge for racquet rental.

Social & Competitive Volleyball & Badminton:
Coming soon

Martial Arts:

Though martial arts classes show starting at a specific time you can arrive at any time from the start time to as late as 8 pm. Just let me know what time you plan to arrive. However, it's always preferred you come at the beginning of a session.

I've been doing Martial Arts since very young and am over 40 now. We will cover the following.

Wing Chun

Muay Thai

BJJ-Brazilian Jiu Jitsu

Hung Ga

Choy Lay Fut

Philippine Stick Fighting

Traditional European Fencing-Not Olympic style but the style used to actually fight / defend yourself.

Chinese Broad Sword

Japanese Sword

Traditional European Fencing

Pole

Spear

Chain Whip

Chi Gung

Tai Chi

Heavy Weapons from SCA / Rennaissance.

This is no joke. I've been doing all of these and more for at least 4 years each up to 20 years for some. Each class will be only $5 for up to 4 hours of training a day. For training in NYC you'll need to bring your own gear if you come to Brooklyn you can use my gear. Please bring the exact amount I won't always have change.

Why am I doing this?

Just to keep my skills sharp. So come and get it if you like a challenge and becoming fit and skilled. Some training will be outdoors on favorable weather days . Otherwise I have a heated garage we will use. I have every weapon you can possibly imagine we'll be using, A Muk Jong / Wooden man and full body protection for at least two people so starting out. As well as kettle bells, lat pull down system, flexibility training devices, elastic bands & iron body conditioning systems. For the colder times of the year come dressed for chilly but not cold temperature and on day 1 you'll see what you will need or may want to get in the future. 

What we train in for the day will be based on who makes the initial training request and a majority preference. 

Don't worry I've done this before and it works out well. 

Before your first class please send me a direct email that you want to attend and what time and where.  For the winter all training will be in Brooklyn, Bensonhurst, D Train to 18th Ave. In the summer trainings will occur either in BK or NYC based on individual request.

On day 1 we'll have to arrange the meeting time so I can come get you. After day 1 you'll be able to come at any point. 

NOTE WHEN I DID THIS BEFORE THERE ARE ALWAYS PEOPLE WHO SAY THEY ARE COMING BUT DON"T SHOW UP. NO SHOWS WITHOUT NOTIFICATION WILL NOT BE ABLE TO CONTINUE. I OFFER A THREE STRIKE POLICY

The mission of New Jersey Screenwriters is to provide formal tools to established and aspiring screenwriters alike while also fostering a sense of community and mutual learning that engenders friendship, fellowship and the potential to create marketable products. This community provides opportunities for writers to acquire or hone a variety of skills, from character development, structure and formatting to pitching. Peer to peer feedback will be a routine aspect of each meeting along with career guidance from industry professionals. Affording opportunities to network both personally and professionally is a foundation of this organization. This is accomplished through the following types of monthly events: - Writing Workshops: We bring in industry professionals for hands-on sessions where you can learn new techniques and skills to improve your work. - Feedback Opportunities and Pitching Practice: You will have many opportunities to present in front of your peers in order to gain exposure and gather feedback. - Networking Events: Meet other writers, actors, directors, producers, and other industry professionals to explore and form new collaborations. - Film Screenings: We curate films based on the group's interest to stimulate and facilitate group discussion and learning. - Guest Speaker Series: We invite active industry professionals who will share their experiences, insights, and advice. The programming of this group and the nature of the support will grow and align with the needs of New Jersey Screenwriters (NJS) members.


Keep up with us in our Google Community: https://plus.google.com/u/0/communities/104069023001226753586

results.description:
Mobile First is now the mantra of every corporation. Customers and employees expect system access from any device, anywhere and at any time. There is an increasingly rich ecosystem of apps, to the delight of their consumers. Corporations are now expecting their IT and Security departments will deliver the flexibility and user experience that mobility promises, but on BYOD with the data and security protections policy demands, and all at a cost that is manageable.

This challenge is now broader than what has been addressed through “traditional” Mobile Device Management or mobile application development. Microsoft's has developed an approach that brings together hybrid identity, information rights management and mobile and applications management, to deliver an Enterprise Mobility service.

This meetup group is an opportunity to discuss and contribute to this rapidly evolving sector and the Microsoft Enterprise Mobility capabilities. We anticipate it being supported by Microsoft, customers, partners and industry personnel alike.
results.name: Microsoft Enterprise Mobility New York

results.description: If you love working with your hands, creating useful and decorative items all while getting to know other like-minded folks in a relaxed environment then pottery making classes are perfect for you! ***Next 8-week term begins week of January 5th! 8-week term costs $250. Centered on the art and craft of ceramics and clay, Yonkers Peace Pottery Studio, located in historic Park Hill, is a pottery school serving lower Westchester, New York, and Bronx neighborhoods, including Riverdale and Woodlawn. Encouraging a warm and relaxed environment to inspire creativity, we offer hand-building, sculpture, and wheel throwing instructional classes for beginner to advanced students, children’s after-school, birthday parties (for children and adults), corporate team building, craft workshops, and studio space rental for experienced clay artists. You will learn more than pottery painting at our studio. You will make the ceramic pieces you paint and glaze.

results.description: This is a support group for gay male couples. There are so many issues affecting gay or same-gender loving (SGL) men as individuals, and many issues that come up when two (or more) gay/SGL men come together to form a relationship. These include issues like coming out/family acceptance; differences in values, priorities and habits; sex, monogamy and sexual or romantic openness; addiction and recovery; financial and life planning issues; health and aging. I have been in a relationship for 25 years and all of these issues have come up. Time and again, my partner and I have felt isolated in wrestling with these issues. I have also had many gay male friends in relationships who have brought these issues up with me in private (and mostly tortured) conversation. Aside from expensive couples counseling, there doesn't seem to be a forum or group for gay male couples partners to share their experiences, seek feedback, ideas and support and offer some in return. (With the group's collective approval, there may be opportunity for a therapist/facilitator seasoned in the issues and experiences of gay men and couples to help guide the discussion.)
results.name: New York Gay Male Couples Support Meetup

results.description:
Introverted? Nervous? Or just a little shy?

This group is for NYC singles on the shy side who want to learn and practice using storytelling to liven up their dating conversations! 

This meetup experience will have you writing and sharing compelling personal stories and getting feedback from the group on how you come across. You will practice listening to another person's story, learning how to ask good questions that keep the conversation going and make your date feel important. 

You'll come out of this workshop with a couple of engaging personal stories to tell on dates and the skills to draw exciting stories out of your date. You'll never have to suffer an awkward silence again!

We use the website StoryShelter to write and share stories that begin our group discussion - so bring your laptops or iPads!
results.name: Storytelling Strategies for Shy Singles

results.description: The world of networking is changing quickly - software defined networking, API's, Python, open source, automation, and other technologies are being introduced and it's clear there's a new skill set required with the next wave of technology. It seems like too much to comprehend, but how does someone get started? The Network Programmability User's Group is a community built around learning and sharing, helps people in different roles like software engineering, network engineering, security management, consulting, architecture, and more start becoming acquainted with new technology. As well, network with your peers and discover new career options. Are interested in learning Python? Want to automate routers, switches and virtual machine configuration? Curious what DevOps is about and how you can get involved? Don't want to be left behind? You're in the right place. The next generation network engineer doesn't need to be a programmer, and the next wave of developers doesn't need to be network engineers, but having some knowledge or skills from both sides is extremely valuable.
results.name: Network Programmability User Group NY Meetup

results.description:
CCNYC is the local chapter of Conscious Capitalism, a national organization rooted in the principles of Conscious Capitalism as described by John Mackey and Raj Sisodia in their seminal book.

The commitment to create a Conscious Capitalism Chapter in one of the world’s global financial centers presents a unique opportunity. Those of us spearheading the effort have felt a great sense of responsibility to create an organization that not only reflects the character and commerce of this city, but also supports the tenets of Conscious Capitalism in a place that unquestionably has tremendous influence over the way capitalism is practiced in the world today. As we move forward, we want to acknowledge the special circumstances and enormous opportunities inherent in building a chapter so close to Wall Street. And so, we’ve come to the conclusion as a group that our chapter must be as inclusive as this city, and also as driven.

We believe Conscious Capitalism is a new paradigm for operating corporations; one that recognizes the power of capitalism to improve the human condition and create enduring value for all stakeholders. We invite anyone who is curious about these ideas and those who already embrace them to join us as we reach high and strive to create change in our society.
results.name: Conscious Capitalism NYC

Newark Pride is a regionally anticipated event that celebrates the accomplishments and richness of Newark's LGBTQ community. Each year Newark Pride provides an array of exciting and memorable programming that attracts over 5,000 people into the heart of Newark.

Newark Pride Week 2015 will feature film screenings, health and wellness events and a range of entertainment for adults, families and youth. Newark Pride has a social capital and economic development impact: it increases awareness of exciting attractions in Newark and surrounding areas while increasing local business revenue. results.description:
“A mystical approach to Judaism is…less dogmatic and more experimental. It doesn’t have a low ceiling, capping the mind and frustrating its desire to unify in love and awe with a vital, living universe. It is open minded, open souled. It says, ‘Try this. If you feel it as a living reality, we’re getting somewhere.’” 

Reb Zalman Schachter-Shalomi zt”l 

This is an incredibly exciting time to be Jewish! As the paradigms shift, it is becoming increasingly clear that much of Judaism is rapidly evolving into a community more attuned to the inner life and focused on awakening, that is, the expansion of consciousness. 

Uri! Uri! Awaken! Awaken! A Community of Spiritual Seekers (for Jews and Non-Jews), now emerging in Flatbush (Brooklyn), is a part of this exciting transition, and we invite you into our experimental boat! 

Come chant, dance, drum, and meditate with us! Grab an oar! 

But first, email us, so we can have a cup of tea together! 

May your Light increase! 

Stay blessed and be well.
results.name: Uri! Uri! Awaken! Awaken!

results.description:
Life in New York is fun but it does take a toll on us. We are always in a rush, always in transition. By the weekend or a day off, we are exhausted and don't even feel that accomplished. In all this vanity, we hardly spend any time with our friends, people we could open ours souls to. We almost never have time or possibility to sit down with a trusted friend and open up about our thoughts and feelings. We push it all down in a constant chase for New York life. No wonder, we get burned out, we loose touch with who we are. Then we make mistakes in our choices when it comes to careers and relationships. We get lost. 
So my dear Goddess we need to find time to create that safe place where we could come together, release our concerns and worries, open our hearts and souls, and connect with our femininity. Let's find the power in sisterhood, and empower each other by connecting and sharing our minds, hearts and souls. Let's create judgment free space to harbor our femininity and empower each other to live in this crazy and amazing city.
results.name: New York Women's Empowerment Meetup
