results.description:
Central NJ Strategic Design + Tech

Driven to ensure New Jersey is a viable state to start and develop businesses, we are gathering creative technologists to discuss our thriving ecosystem of innovators, educators, engineers, entrepreneurs, policy makers, and the capital community.

Mission

The mission of this group is to support and aid people from all markets and technology areas. Our hope is to help people accelerate the process, and reduce the risk of moving from concept, into production and releasing to the public market. We want to help educate on new ways of designing, prototyping, building and fulfilling tech hardware, software, systems, & components.


We will be focused on many different topics during MeetUps:

• Startups, Entrepreneurialism, and Growing Business in NJ

• Civic Engagement and Gov’t Policy

• Workforce Diversity

• Education & Technology (EdTech, 21st Ed)

• Capitalization and Fundraising (VC, angels, crowdfunding)

• Strategic Design & Sustainable Business Models

• Disruption and Innovation

• User Experience (UX)

• Manufacturing

• Hardware and Software Engineering

• Maker movement

• Emergent Technology

• Mobile development

• Internet of Things and Wearables

• Big Data, Machine Learning, Predictive Analytics

• BioTech

• FinTech

• User Interface Design & Information Architecture

• Marketing and Business Networking


All meetup discussions will be supplemented with time for hands-on learning workshops. This is a group formed exists to support the startup community .

• Presentations

• Demo Nights

• Hackathons

• Coworking

• Startup Weekends

• Networks

• Show and Tell


Necessary Stakeholders in the EcoSystem - If this is you, come on out:

• Coworking spots

• Developers

• Entrepreneurs

• Designers

• Capital Community

• Educational professionals

• Government leaders


To be clear, we're looking to collaborate with the many other MeetUps in the area and welcome interaction so don't overlap too much and conflict. If you're organizing another MeetUp in this domain, this is another venue for you to network and present your ideas – we welcome the collaboration and conversation with kindred spirits.
results.name: NJ Strategic Design + Tech

results.description: This is a group for people who would like to learn about many metaphysical topics including tarot, astrology, Feng Shui, meditation, angels, pendulums and many other topics. It is for someone who has an interest in expanding their mind to all of the possibilities our vast universe has to offer.
results.name: Butler Metaphysics Meetup

results.description:
SAY HELLO TO YOUR NEW FRIENDS.

Our mission is to bring adventure and fun into your life while building lifelong friendships. As Eleanor Roosevelt once said, “the purpose of life is to live it, to taste experience to the utmost, to reach out eagerly and without fear for newer and richer experience.” And, that’s exactly what Welcome to Queens is all about! We are a fun group of young professionals with varied interests who are looking to get out, foster new friendships, and enjoy life.

We are a group of young professionals 21-39 looking to explore Queens.

Are you tired of sitting at home? Is it hard to get together with friends who are married or have moved away? Is the weekly bar scene getting boring and old to you? Well you are not alone! Modern day society has caused people to feel completely frazzled and out of sync with nature and enjoying what life has to offer. Get ready to dust off that bucket list and start living life to the fullest!

We pride ourselves in creating and organizing exciting and unique experiences. Have you ever thought what it might be like to be a trapeze circus performer? What about the exciting pastime of exploring wild caves – Spelunking? Or maybe, you’re into some indoor fun such as Dodgeball, Laser Tag, and Slam Dunk Basketball.

Our activities include everything from dinner and drinks and fun nightlife activities, to ski and camping weekend getaways, and everything in between. Do you want to ignite your summer with sky diving, parasailing, fun BBQ’s, and participating in sports activities such as Volleyball and Kickball? Do you have life goals such as running in a Spartan or Survival race? If you are looking to get off of the couch, meet new people, and have a blast, then Welcome to Queens is the group for you.
results.name: Welcome to Queens 21-39

results.description:
Do you love Jamaica Bay? Lend your voice and make a difference!

Join the National Parks Conservation Association and the Jamaica Bay Advocates to stay connected to all things happening in Jamaica Bay. Learn about upcoming events, find job postings, and be the voice of the bay!

Explore your waters. Defend your park. Find your voice.
results.name: Jamaica Bay Advocates

results.description:
The world is #drivenbydata and we aim to empower the masses by sharing knowledge and expertise on all things Data.

We will discuss real data challenges and how to overcome them with the latest BI and data management tools. We will demo new products, present how-tos and best practices, and hold hands on training sessions on BI and Data Science topics.

We hold regular sessions every second Tuesday of the month, and additional sessions for training days or other tech events.
results.name: Tech Tuesday

results.description:
A Billion Entrepreneurs Foundation, Inc. presents: New York Business Meetup Workshop Series

The workshops are based on the successful Business Finishing School curriculum that focuses on the 12 Foundation Principles of Business.

Business Finishing School (“BFS”) is a leading business-growth education company that teaches “next-level” business principles; which are beyond the usual marketing, accounting, and management concepts.

Are you operating at your best inside your business?

Is the business you own (or work for) fully on purpose and hitting all of its objectives?

BFS believes that all businesses should sit firmly on top of the 12 Foundational Principles of Business, in order to maximize potential and growth. BFS has created a blueprint that virtually any motivated entrepreneur, executive, or employee can implement. This blueprint will add systemization and predictability to your growth and profit. By adopting these 12 principles, your organization will increase the probability of long-term success, while leveraging the talents and experience of all involved.

The Business Finishing School team will walk through the steps of a better framework for business and personal success; using an approach which builds on purpose-driven behavior. These events can be used to refocus your business or to plan a new venture the right way from the start. These meetups are a great way to learn about other local resources for entrepreneurs and connect with others who share the same passion for success.
results.name: New York Business Meetup

results.description:
This group is for those who are looking to embrace who they truly are by becoming more consciously aware . We offer workshops and meditations that promote healing along with self-discovery. Our goal is provide you with individual or group focused life force energy healing by teaching exploratory workshops specializing in the healing arts that will allow you to create a life you love to live. We believe in helping others know and appreciate negative emotion so they could lead more peaceful lives and achieve happiness. "The time has come to stop trying to feel better and instead become better at feeling" ~ Teal Swan

Visit us at www.lovehealinglifecenter.com!

topics.name: Social Group for Singles 45 and Older

results.description: Being single in New York City, I thought it would be great to start a walking group.  The purpose of this group is to take something you love to do (walking) and make it possible for others (45-55) to come out and enjoy a nice walk in this wonderful city we live in and at the same time meet new people: ).  Walks will usually take place near Central Park.  In the Spring when the weather starts getting warmer, will plan walks along the Hudson and around Manhattan as well.  For those who would like to socialize after the walk (ie: bite to eat - that can be planned too)! Group is new as of mid-January 2015, so just feeling things out.  Suggestions welcome.
results.name: UWS New York City Active Singles - (45-55) - Walking Group

results.description: This group is for people who were members of the University Press Club at Princeton University. Let's get together to swap stories, socialize, and maybe cover some topics of professional interest, too. (This group will be limited to people we can confirm attended Princeton and participated in UPC.)
results.name: New York UPC Alums Meetup

results.description:
This is a group for anyone loves old school Hip-Hop, clubbing, dancing and having fun in the city that never sleeps. 

One of the problems we have is that the Hip-Hop clubbing scene in the city has faded away and almost disappeared! We are working on bringing it back with the best events this city has ever scene.

Join us now on our meetup group to see about our upcoming events and activities  - http://hiphopparty.nyc/
results.name: Old School Hip-Hop Parties NYC

results.description:
About Us:

• Event Organizing: Want to Organize your own Events? Message the Group Organizer.


• Outdoor Adventure: Hiking, Tours, Camping, Travel, Boating, and other Outdoor Events.

• Culinary Exploration: Wine Tasting, Weekend Brunch, Weekday Dinners, and other .

• Friends: You will make tons of Friends for life and expand your social circle. 

• Girls Night Out: We have Girls only events and free yourself from that guy problem.

• Social Networking: Maybe you will meet someone that will set you up with a career.

• And MORE
results.name: NYC Asian Meetup

results.description:
This purpose of the Real Estate Matchmaking Meetup is to help connect real estate investors to the right professionals in order to grow their business. At our events, real estate professionals of diverse backgrounds are able to network and exchange ideas, resources and skills that compliment each others businesses. Whether you are a real estate investor, broker, title agent, hard money lender, accountant or attorney, we will help facilitate introductions to the right people to increase your referrals.

We meet in a format that is more condusive to deals being done and all our members get an opportunity to share their business knowledge with the community members.
results.name: Real Estate Matchmaking Meetup

results.description: Calling all Young Professionals, College students, Young Adults who love to sing gospel music! The Salem Rebirth Choir is a choir that is founded within the Historic Salem United Methodist Church in Harlem! The choir sings every third Sunday 10 months out of the year. We also have Choir outings to fellowship and get to know each other through the year. Our repertoire consist of mainly contemporary gospel, but we also sing other forms of gospel as well such as anthems, old school gospel with a new school twist, spirituals and choral arrangements . We are looking for people between the ages of 20-40( if you a little bit older that is fine too) who have some musical background or can sing to some extent and who love to sing gospel music. For More information about the church please visit the website: http://www.salem-harlem.org
results.name: Young Adults Who Like To Sing Gospel Music!

results.name: Hastings on Hudson #MeetupMonday

results.description: #UnconventionalMarketing is a group where we'll unearth some of the most interesting, innovative and off-the-wall branding methods happening today. New products and companies will only need to move faster, while attention spans get shorter and shorter. We can complain about today's consumer all we want, or we can put our heads together to create some cool and actionable campaign ideas. We'll be scrapping the cliche'd hour of one person talking to a group, followed by the hour of wine, carrots and ranch dressing while pretending to bump into someone by total accident as to not feel awkward starting a conversation. We'll collaborate, whiteboard, scribble, yell, argue, laugh, and okay... maybe there'll also be carrots and ranch dressing at this meetup as well.
results.name: #Unconventional NYC

results.description:
'To love thyself is the beginning of a lifelong romance.' - Oscar Wilde. 

Have an interest in Glamour/Boudoir photography?  Want to meet other women who are also interested in it and see what it's like to pose for a photographer?  Have you always wanted to try it, but were afraid to go for it? Well, you're not alone.  This is your lucky day.  Meet and work with other beautiful women who also want to have the same experience... in a group setting, where it's not too intimidating.

Meet other women who are interested in this type of photography and learn from each other on how they style their wardrobe, hair and makeup... to get the best results. 

Want to learn from a professional photographer the best ways to pose for the best outcome?  

Are you a makeup artist or hair stylist who wants to come and practice your services on our models?  Then this is the right group for you!

Glamour/Boudoir Photographer Annie Watson, located in Cos Cob, CT has been building women’s confidence and self esteem for years with her innate talent, eye for perfection, passion for beauty and desire to help women feel and look their best. We will hold some events in our gorgeous studio where you can come in with your girlfriends, enjoy some refreshments, and experience the exhilaration of a Glamour/Boudoir Photography session. We ask that you bring 3-5 sexy outfits, have your makeup and hair done to a 'T' - and get ready to have fun! These events will be open to women only - over the age of 26. To see our work, go to www dot anniewatson dot com. This is a special complimentary photo session that will enable women to afford the luxury of a sexy, intimate portrait most women only dream of. You don’t want to miss this! Photographs will be available for purchase in a Reveal Session after the event. All participants will be asked to sign a release.
results.name: Greenwich Glamour Girls - Glamour/Boudoir Photo Sessions

results.description:
Hello,
I would like to get a group together to walk in Clove Lakes Park.
Mornings- 6am-7am
Evenings - 6:30pm-7:30pm
Weekends- open for suggestions.

I would also like to see if there is free yoga in Clove Lakes Park.
results.name: Staten Island Outdoors Meetup

results.description: A group focused on the art of Instagram marketing with the strategists and artists who are helping shape the world’s most popular visual marketing medium.
results.name: Instacamp: Instagram Marketing Meetup

results.description: This is a group for anyone who loves art, discussions and learning. For newbies and long time art buffs alike. I would love to meet once a month and select a topic, have listed readings or articles on the topic that anyone has come across and would like to share, and suggestions welcome.
results.name: New York Art Meetup

results.description: Marvin J. Oni and Ruben U are back with another edition of Thrillvia! Watch as we challenge Dee Marie Dominic Leonelli and Kerry Overfab Coddett on all things geek. Movies, video games, novels of the graphic kind, even anime. Who will take home the secret grand prize!? Hosted by Marvelous Marv and Sydnee Washington will be our Vanna White and say some funny stuff.
results.name: MOR presents a night of Thrillvia game show

topics.name: Sport Bikes, Street Bikes, Motorcycle Meetups
Sharing a Love of Motorcycle Riding

results.description:
Ministry of CMA

Vision:  Changing the world, one heart at a time.

We will accomplish our vision through:

Evangelistic outreach primarily, but not exclusively, to the motorcycling community.  Run for the Son, where we will partner with ministries with world-reaching potential.  Equipping our members in ministry training that aligns itself with Biblical truths.  A servant's attitude to the world and to our members (i.e. Here if you need us).  Quality products that aid in evangelistic outreach.  An effective WorkCenter support team.

CMA Ministry Partners:
CMA partners with three other ministries (Jesus Film Project, Missionary Ventures, and Open Doors) to spread the Gospel around the world. In 2013 CMA donated $788,070.90 to each one of the three ministries as a result of the Run for the Son fundraiser.

Mission:
To inspire our leaders and members to be the most organized, advanced, equipped, financially stable organization, full of integrity in the motorcycling industry and the Kingdom of God.

Doctrinal Statement:
The Christian Motorcyclists Association is interdenominational and evangelistic in nature.

We believe in:

• The Bible as the inspired and infallible Word of God.

• One God, eternally existent in three persons: Father, Son and Holy Spirit.

• The virgin birth and deity of Christ, His explicit atoning death, bodily resurrection and ascension.

• Salvation through the blood of Jesus Christ.

• The sanctifying power of the Holy Spirit who enables a believer to live holy.

• The second coming of Jesus Christ.


For information on becoming an official member of CMA please visit this link below:

http://www.cmausa.org/ministry/membership-requirements.asp

results.description:
This Group is for Woman who suffer from Mood Disorders ages 21+ only.

What we are About: Our group is to reach out to woman in the New York area who suffer from Mood Disorders "diagnosed or not" for support and friendship. This group will bond woman of ages 21+ who can relate and understand one another through the voices of honest experiences-past and present as well as develop new long term friendships with exciting group activities.

Please visit our facebook page: <br>Www.facebook.com/strongwomenwithmd

Visit our blog page: <br>Strongwomenwithmd.wordpress.com

Visit our Twitter page: <br>Strong Women with MD

Visit our Instagram: <br>STRONG_WOMEN_W_MD

Our email is: <br>Strongwomenwithmd@gmail.com

Our Goal:  To help women just like us with mood disorders... Have you ever had a day where you could not get out of bed, a day where you lied to get out of a date that was planned, a night/week you could not sleep, a day where you could not eat or ate too much, a day you could not pay your bills, a day you realized you were the reason for losing your jobs, a day where no one understood you, a day you felt all alone, or even a day where you felt as if you wanted to die? That STOPS NOW!

Our hope for this group is to be there for one another through these times with support and no judgement. Our group is to build bonds with honesty that will lead to communication, trust and hopefully long term friendships that will result in fun activities.

This group will have bi-weekly meet ups for group discussion about our lives and at the end of each meet up we all will decide what we want our end of the month (or more) activity to be.

Group Commitment: This group will require you to be 100% honest in commitment to yourself and all of us when joining. We will ask you to read, post and share in our blog which will help inspire yourself and others. This blog will be about us, gratification and our success in friendship.  

strongwomenwithmd.wordpress.com 

RSVP & Attendee Policy: You should be able to attend at least one event per month. Anyone who has not attended an event within the first few months of joining will be removed. as the goal is to be an active member. If you RSVP yes, please do not cancel the day of the event. If you need to cancel, please do so within 48 hours of the event. No shows will not be tolerated and can lead to removal from the group. Changing your RSVP on the day of the event without notifiction is just as bad as not showing up. We take the time to make reservations and hold spot for you. Please keep the event host informed. 

Please understand and thank you.

Please keep in mind we are not licensed doctors or therapists. We are just like you. This group consists of woman sharing their stories and are here to listen and support only.

We look forward to meeting you,

Megan and Vanessa

A STRONG WOMAN is one who feels deeply and loves fiercely. Her tears flow just as abundantly as her laughter. A STRONG WOMAN is both soft and powerful. She is both practical and spiritual. A STRONG WOMAN in her essence is a GIFT to the world!
results.name: Friendship & Support Group For Women With Mood Disorders

“Top of the Morning To You!” - an unusual Sabbath service!

results.description:
As a business owner or entrepreneur, are you serious about using networking to grow your business?

Networking matters whether you want new customers, repeat business, referrals or attention of potential investors. However, it is seldom taught anywhere and consequently most networkers fail to get adequate return out of their investment in business networking meetings.


Business networking is not about exchanging cards!

There are tools such as elevator pitches, one-on-ones, strategic alliances, follow ups and social media that you need to master. Whether you are a pro or a newbie, our tools help you tremendously in honing your business networking skills. Our events are quality events that help you grow into a power networker who gets real business out of networking meetings. We also strive to create a synergistic referral network for you.

At our events you can:

• Mingle with like minded individuals and create strong business relationships.

• Reach everyone in the meetup through elevator pitches.

• Take part in our highly successful interactive educational programs.

• Learn more about the mindset and skills of business ownership.

• Learn about and create strategic alliances.

• Become a spotlight speaker and promote your business.

About myself: I have been organizing one of the highest ranked NY Connect and Grow business networking group on meetup with 4200+ members and felt a need of a networking group which teaches people how to network. Looking forward to meet you at our next event!
results.name: New York Business Networking For Results

results.description:
*Welcome to New York Entrepreneur Mastermind. The concept of the "mastermind alliance" was formally introduced by Napoleon Hill in his timeless classic, "Think And Grow Rich," though mastermind groups have been around since the beginning of time. The purpose of the group is to support and hold each other accountable to our personal and professional goals. For more about Mastermind go here: 

http://www.thesuccessalliance.com/what-is-a-mastermind-group.html

Napoleon Hill wrote about the mastermind group principle as: "The coordination of knowledge and effort of two or more people, who work toward a definite purpose, in the spirit of harmony." He continues…"No two minds ever come together without thereby creating a third, invisible intangible force, which may be likened to a third mind [the master mind]."

Whether you are just starting out in the world of business or you have done this one thousand time. This mastermind is a place to get

 feedback, help you brainstorm new possibilities, and set up accountability structures that keep you focused and on track. You create a community of supportive colleagues who brainstorm together to move the members to new heights.


You'll gain tremendous insights which improve your business and personal life. Your mastermind group is like having a objective board of directors, a success team, and a peer advisory group, all rolled into one.
results.name: New York Entrepreneurs Mastermind

topics.name: Young Women Affected by Breast Cancer

results.description:
We Race Because… 
•One in eight women in the U.S. will be diagnosed with breast cancer in her lifetime. 
•Because every minute, somewhere in the world, someone dies from breast cancer. 
•And because, breast cancer knows no boundaries- be it age, gender, socio-economic status or geographic location. 
•We continue to Race because at the current rate, 13 million breast cancer deaths around the world will occur in the next 25 years. 

But, when you participate and fundraise for the Race, we fight these statistics together. In 1980, the 5-year relative survival rate for women diagnosed with early stage breast cancer (cancer confined to the breast) was about 74 percent. Today, that number is 99 percent! Komen has played a critical role in every major advance in the fight against breast cancer - transforming how the world talks about and treats this disease and helping to turn millions of breast cancer patients into breast cancer survivors. This progress was made with your continued support and together we can reach our vision of a world without breast cancer.
results.name: Susan G. Komen North Jersey Race For the Cure Meetups

results.description:
"Food is more than survival. With it we make friends, court lovers, and count our blessings." - Nat Geo 

This group is intended to bring together food lovers primarily in their 20s and early 30s. The goal is to make new friends, enjoy delicious food, and learn about different cultures. If you have a particular cuisine or restaurant you would like to try, feel free to let us know. We are always looking for cultural ambassadors who can show us their foods. 

DETAILS: We will have both small and large group dinners. 

• Small group (4-6 people) 

• Large group (6-12 people) 

In addition to dinners, to keep things interesting, we will host other events: 

• Coffee/Tea Meetups

• Food Crawls (sampling of food from different restaurants that are within walking distance) 

• Happy Hours/Bar Meetups 

• Karaoke 

• Sports 

• Picnics 

• Comedy Clubs 

• Shows 

• Game Night

RULES: 

1) FEES: We don’t believe in charging people to make friends. However, we also know that inconsiderate RSVPs spoil the experience for everyone. For most events we will charge a $1 maintenance fee, this is not to make money.  The money goes toward the group and covers the monthly website fee.  

2) ATTENDANCE: Most events will be first come first serve. If you RSVP and cannot go, please provide notice a day in advance. Of course, we understand there are emergencies, but please do let us know. 

3) RSVP policy: If you RSVP and cancel the day before the meetup, please send the organizer(s) a message to notify them. If you fail to do so or RSVP and do not show up, you will be temporarily suspended from the next meetup. If you RSVP and do not show up on occasion depending on the circumstances you may be either suspended from the group for a longer period of time, or removed from the group. Though this may sound harsh, please understand that the organizers put time and effort into planning these meetups. More importantly, this gives others a chance to attend our events. 

4) Profile pictures: Please have a clear photo of yourself when you join. We know you're not actually the NY skyline or a cartoon character.  :)

Thank you and we look forward to meeting you all!
results.name: NYC Young Food Lovers
